image.altText: A man with very short greying hair in a suit and tie sits in a television studio looking serious.

props.synopsis: ACT Chief Minister Andrew Barr acknowledges that leadership of the Labor party will "need to transition to a new generation" but argues stability is vital as Labor governs without the Greens.

title.children: 'Not thinking of retirement': Barr concedes succession looms but says experience key

image.altText: Sena, an older woman wearing a headscarf and purple vest, stands looking serious, leaning against a wall.

props.synopsis: Sena Husic left a war-zone in Bosnia 30 years ago for Australia, and went on to suffer debilitating spinal pain because of the language barrier she struggled to overcome. Now she's finally received treatment, but there a calls for translators to bridge the gap.

title.children: Sena needed surgery, but she couldn't understand her doctors

image.altText: The exterior of a concrete building with the words "Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory" over the entry.

props.synopsis: A 17-year-old Canberra boy is behind bars after shocking allegations he developed detailed plans for public attacks and had equipment to create a bomb in his bedroom.

title.children: Canberra 'wannabe terrorist' behind bars over plans to attack protesters

image.altText: David Pocock

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese's 2023 promise to fix a "building with buckets to collect leaks" remains unfulfilled, according to the National Gallery of Australia's annual report.

title.children: Pocock slams government over leaky roof housing $5b national collection

image.altText: A man and a woman walking along the street.

props.synopsis: Three men at the centre of one of NSW's biggest corruption cases are fighting to overturn their jail terms over a $30 million coal deal tied to a family property.

title.children: Obeids and Macdonald take $30m coal corruption case to High Court

image.altText: A woman with long blonde hair wearing a black blazer stands in a conference room looking serious.

props.synopsis: The Australian National University's dire financial situation is "improving", and interim vice-chancellor Rebekah Brown says the university has now set a new target of delivering a surplus next year.

title.children: Rebekah Brown says ANU campus 'a lot calmer' since she came on board

image.altText: A boy does an activity at a table with his father.

props.synopsis: Liam used to dread walking through the school gates. Now, he can't wait to learn — but it took leaving a system that made him feel ignored to get there.

title.children: 'Terrible to watch': Why one family pulled their son from a Canberra public school

image.altText: Waves hit a coastal wall.

props.synopsis: Forecasters warn that Kalmaegi could dump more than 600 millimetres of rain in Vietnam.

title.children: Typhoon Kalmaegi makes landfall in Vietnam after killing 114 in Philippines

image.altText: Close up of middle-aged man looking past camera

props.synopsis: The announcement comes six months after the ABC first reported the Northern Territory Racing and Wagering Commission chair had accepted corporate hospitality from bookmakers.

title.children: Gambling regulator stops accepting gifts from betting companies, for now

image.altText: A blonde woman in a dark outfit sits with her hands clasped in parliament.

props.synopsis: Liberal MPs will return to parliament on Wednesday to thrash out a position on the party's net zero commitment ahead of a joint party room meeting with the Nationals next Sunday.

title.children: Liberals recalled to parliament to thrash out net zero problem

image.altText: The silhouette of an oil pumpjack in the foreground with a wind turbine in the background.

props.synopsis: Missing from the line-up at the key summit in Brazil are the leaders of four of the world's five most-polluting economies — China, the United States, India and Russia.

title.children: Inaction on 1.5C climate change target a 'moral failure', says UN chief at COP30

image.altText: A woman in a white blouse sits outdoors, painting at a table.

props.synopsis: A Victorian parliament probe into the impacts of cults and organised fringe groups hears lived experience testimony from two women who grew up in high-control religious groups.

title.children: Mirriam grew up in the Church of Scientology and now is pushing for change

image.altText: Close-up of mouse-like creature with dark black eyes standing on browny red dirt under bush with yellow ball flowers.

props.synopsis: Animals and plants aren't automatically taken off most national and state extinct species list in Australia if they are rediscovered, leaving them without protection as threatened species.

title.children: This tiny native mouse is legally considered both dead and alive

image.altText: Two people holding out their forearms and applying sunscreen on a sunny beach.

props.synopsis: A review by Australia's pharmaceutical regulator has raised concerns about "endocrine disruptors" in some sunscreens. Is there any reason to be worried?

title.children: What is the safest sunscreen you can use?

image.altText: A German police officer with his back turned to the camera, with Polizei written on his vest.

props.synopsis: The Nazi symbol was smeared dozens of times on cars, letter boxes and building facades, with tests confirming they were daubed in human blood.

title.children: German police investigate swastikas drawn in human blood

image.altText: A carton of imported cigarettes sitting seized in a warehouse

props.synopsis: Authorities stress the $4 billion figure is conservative, as it does not include illegal vapes and e-cigarettes.

title.children: Australia's $4 billion illicit tobacco trade fuels a violent criminal market

image.altText: A man speaking at a lecturn, with a sign on it that reads A New Era for New York City

props.synopsis: The blistering rise of New York City's new mayor, Zohran Mamdani, has captured global attention. So what's going on and what does his win say about the American political climate?

title.children: Mamdani's triumph in New York is making waves around the world

image.altText: A giant black smoke plume rising above a suburban skyline, trees and a cargo train

props.synopsis: Louisville Mayor Craig Greenberg has confirmed the death toll has risen to at least 11 and could increase further to 12 or more, with several people still missing.

title.children: UPS plane  death toll rises, authorities say engine fell off before crash

image.altText: bob katter close up portrait

props.synopsis: "There will be a corner of this Parliament House that is forever Bob Katter," the prime minister said this week.

title.children: Katter gets an early Christmas present, while Coalition stalls on net zero

image.altText: Auction sign on house replaced with sold sign

props.synopsis: To advertise a property for $1 million, knowing it must sell above $1.3 million, is illegal. It is called underquoting, and in NSW it is rife, according to data analysis.

title.children: Real estate agents bait buyers to auction by underquoting prices

image.altText: Three men dressed in black walk with a woman in a beige dress on green carpet.

props.synopsis: Prince William has joined Kylie Minogue and Shawn Mendes, along with a swag of world leaders and celebrities, for the annual Earthshot Prize awards in Rio de Janeiro.

title.children: Prince William joins world leaders, celebs for green-carpeted Earthshot Prize awards

image.altText: An armed guard walking past the iconic pyramid entrance to the Louvre museum.

props.synopsis: France's highest auditor says the theft of $157 million worth of jewels was a "deafening alarm bell" for the world-renowned Parisian museum.

title.children: Louvre prioritised art over upgrading security, report says

image.altText: A uniformed police officer and Indigenous woman wearing a pattern dress.

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory Police Force has released its first anti-racism strategy for staff, following years of headlines about racist attitudes that have dogged the organisation.

title.children: 'We can't fix what we don't face': NT Police unveils anti-racism plan

image.altText: A close shot of Brereton, who is sitting in the offices of the new national anti--corruption commission

props.synopsis: The inspector of the National Anti-Corruption Commission is inquiring into the agency's head, Paul Brereton, in relation to several complaints including from a former employee.

title.children: Anti-corruption commission watchdog inquiring into NACC chief Brereton

image.altText: A multi-legged, black drone mid-flight in front of a blurry helicopter silhouette

props.synopsis: The United States-built Merops system can identify drones and close in on them, using artificial intelligence to navigate.

title.children: Poland and Romania deploy new defence system against Russian drones

image.altText: A drone shot of a lake with shacks on the edge.

props.synopsis: Police and volunteer ambulance officers have told a community meeting they struggle to connect with people during emergencies due to poor 4G access in central Tasmania.

title.children: In this town, residents say poor reception is endangering lives

image.altText: an old 2028 image of serial rapist Graham James Kay getting into a car after leaving court

props.synopsis: Convicted rapist Graham Kay will remain in custody after sexually touching a 16-year-old girl in the Sydney CBD while on a strict supervision order.

title.children: Serial rapist admits to sexually touching 16yo girl in Sydney pharmacy

image.altText: A girl looking at the camera with a beach behind.

props.synopsis: The findings of a coronial inquest into the death of German backpacker Simone Strobel in Lismore in 2005 have been delivered.

title.children: Boyfriend welcomes findings of inquest into backpacker's cold case murder

image.altText: A truck crashed into a bridge

props.synopsis: A cherry picker passenger has died after the vehicle crashed into a bridge in the NSW Central West, causing it to collapse.

title.children: Transport worker dead after bridge collapses in cherry picker crash

image.altText: Claire Austin who was the victim of an alleged domestic violence attack holds a glass of wine while smiling at the camera

props.synopsis: The 44-year-old is charged almost seven months after Claire Austin's death in Randwick.

title.children: Man charged with murder and coercive control after woman's death

image.altText: A cassowary in a dry grassland.

props.synopsis: Queensland's department of environment says it has no plans to relocate a cassowary spotted roaming the dry Gulf Savannah.

title.children: Cassowary wandering 150km from home baffles outback residents

image.altText: An aerial shot of a small town.

props.synopsis: Fosterville Gold Mine in central Victoria is approved to continue running until 2045 despite concerns from neighbours and environmental advocates.

title.children: Federal govt approves expansion of Victoria's largest gold mine

image.altText: Saul Eslake sits in a chair.

props.synopsis: Independent economist Saul Eslake and Deloitte's Cedric Hodges warn there is no easy way out of Tasmania's dire budget situation, after the treasurer delivered an "interim" budget with little in the way of concrete solutions for fixing the state's debt.

title.children: Tasmania's budget 'pretty dire' with 'no easy way out', economists say

image.altText: A woman with long blonde hair in a strapless dress holds an award and stands between a man and a woman on a stage.

props.synopsis: The radio host and former TV presenter has been recognised for her fundraising work to progress brain cancer research.

title.children: Media identity Carrie Bickmore named Victorian Australian of the Year

image.altText: A woman with long black hair and wearing a black top sits at a laptop at a desk.

props.synopsis: AI's rapid uptake in Australian workplaces has many workers asking how they can stay relevant.

title.children: 'My $40K degree is worthless now': How AI is erasing jobs once thought safe
